page.title: 10TANDLE HILL COUNTRY PARK
page.content:
TANDLE HILL COUNTRY PARK
Tandle Hill Country Park was given to the people of Royton by Mr. Norris Brabury of Tynwald Park in 1919. He gave the land to the people to celebrate the peace after the first World War. The monument in the park is a war memorial. The monument is 8.5 metres tall. The plaques with the names of the dead from the wars have been moved to St.Paul's church, Royton so they are not damaged. The monument is on the top of the highest hill for everyone to see. It is a landmark. Tandle Hill Country Park is a lovely place for picnics in the summer time and for sledging in the winter.
